Module guigame
Package guigame.logic.main

Class GameBoard

java.lang.Object
guigame.logic.main.GameBoard
public class GameBoard
extends java.lang.Object
Class to represent the Game Board in the game. Only when state == RUNNING, PAUSE or BETWEEN_POINTS

  • Constructor Details

    • GameBoard

      public GameBoard​(int width, int height, MainGame mainGame, boolean human)
      Parameters:
      width - Width of the GameBoard
      height - Height of the GameBoard
      mainGame - The MainGame to invoke GameState changes on
      human - Whether there is one human player or not

  • Method Details

    • setGUIBoard

      private void setGUIBoard()
      Create a new GUIBoard.

    • addPoint

      public boolean addPoint​(Directions directionLoser) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      One point is over. Adds a point to one of the player and calculates whether one player has won the match.
      Parameters:
      directionLoser - The direction into which the ball went off the field
      Returns:
      Whether the game is over now
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the directionLoser is neither LEFT nor RIGHT

    • playerWonPoint

      private boolean playerWonPoint​(boolean right)
      Do calculations for the winning player.
      Parameters:
      right - Whether the right player has won the point or not
      Returns:
      Whether the game is over now

    • getState

      public GameState getState()
      Returns:
      the current game state

    • setState

      public void setState​(GameState newState)
      Sets the new game state. Prefer the methods below over setState.
      Parameters:
      newState - the new game state
      See Also:
      pauseGame(), resumeGame(), resumeBetweenPoints(), showPauseBetweenPoints()

    • rightIsHuman

      public boolean rightIsHuman()
      Returns:
      Whether there is a human playing or two AIs

    • pauseGame

      public void pauseGame()
      Pauses the game: Set the state to PAUSED and do not loop.

    • resumeGame

      public void resumeGame()
      Resume the game: Set the state to RUNNING and do loop.

    • showPauseBetweenPoints

      public void showPauseBetweenPoints()
      Pauses the game: Set the state to PAUSED_BETWEEN_POINTS and do not loop.

    • resumeBetweenPoints

      public void resumeBetweenPoints()
      Pauses the game: Set the state to BETWEEN_POINTS and do not loop.

    • getGuiBoard

      public GUIGameBoard getGuiBoard()
      Returns:
      the GUI-board

    • getPlayers

      public Players getPlayers()
      Returns:
      The players playing against each other.

      the game board's height

      the game board's width
